metadata.title: CVE-2014-2330 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerabilities in the MultisiteGUI in Check_MK before 1.2.5i2 allow remote attackers to hijack theauthentication of users for requests that (1) upload arbitrary snapshots,(2) delete arbitrary files, or possibly have other unspecified impact viaunknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2330` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

check-mk-agent - 1.2.2p3-1
check-mk-agent-logwatch - 1.2.2p3-1
check-mk-config-icinga - 1.2.2p3-1
check-mk-config-nagios3 - 1.2.2p3-1
check-mk-livestatus - 1.2.2p3-1
check-mk-multisite - 1.2.2p3-1
check-mk-server - 1.2.2p3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: check-mk package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.2p3-1').
